Add Trading Strategy to Market Data

Source: R/strategy.R
add_strategy.Rd

Adds trading strategy signals to a market_tbl object. This function allows you to define entry and exit rules, position sizing, and other strategy parameters.

Usage

add_strategy(
  data,
  name = "Strategy",
  entry_rules,
  exit_rules,
  position_size = 1000,
  side = "long",
  stop_loss = NULL,
  take_profit = NULL,
  commission = 0.001,
  slippage = 5e-04
)

Arguments

data

A market_tbl object

name

Character string naming the strategy (default: "Strategy")

entry_rules

Expression or logical vector defining entry conditions

exit_rules

Expression or logical vector defining exit conditions

position_size

Numeric value or function for position sizing

side

Character: "long", "short", or "both" (default: "long")

stop_loss

Numeric value for stop loss percentage (e.g., 0.05 for 5%)

take_profit

Numeric value for take profit percentage

commission

Numeric value for commission rate (e.g., 0.001 for 0.1%)

slippage

Numeric value for slippage rate

Value

A market_tbl object with added strategy columns

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
library(tradeengine)

# Simple moving average crossover
strategy <- prices |>
  add_strategy(
    name = "SMA_Cross",
    entry_rules = sma_fast > sma_slow,
    exit_rules = sma_fast < sma_slow,
    position_size = 1000
  )
} # }
